content:
{[Co(tmphen)2]3[Fe(CN)6]2}. The CoIII 2CoIIFeII 2 blue solid form of the cluster was prepared by a variation of our previously reported synthesis. A solution of [(18-crown-6)K]3[Fe(CN)6] was prepared by stirring of 180 mg (0.547 mmol) of K3[Fe(CN)6] and 408 mg (1.54 mmol) of 18-crown-6 in 60 mL of acetonitrile for 24 h and filtering of the resulting solution to remove the excess K3[Fe(CN)6]. The other solution was prepared by combining 300 mg (1.03 mmol) of Co(NO3)2·6H2O with 609 mg (2.58 mmol) of tmphen in 150 mL of acetonitrile. To this solution was slowly added the [Fe(CN)6]3− solution, and the mixture was left to stand undisturbed for 3 days. The red crystals were collected by filtration, washed with acetonitrile (15 mL) and diethyl ether (30 mL), dried in vacuo, and left in air for at least 2 weeks to allow the sample to absorb ∼24 water molecules of hydration. Yield: 477 mg (75%).

{[Ni(tmphen)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>3</sub>[Os(CN)<sub>6</sub>]<sub>2</sub>}

A sample of Ni(BF4)2·6H2O (109 mg, 0.320 mmol) was added to 157 mg (0.664 mmol) of tmphen in 80 mL of acetonitrile, and the mixture was stirred for 30 min to afford a clear pale-pink solution. This solution was added to (PPN)3[Os(CN)6] (762 mg, 0.388 mmol) in 80 mL of acetonitrile. The mixture was left to stand for 5 days, after which time transparent orange needlelike crystals that had formed were collected by filtration, washed with acetonitrile (2 × 20 mL), and dried in vacuo. Yield: 212 mg (42%).

Mixture of {[Co(tmphen)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>3</sub>[Fe(CN)<sub>6</sub>]<sub>2</sub>[Mn(CH<sub>3</sub>OH)<sub>4</sub>]}<sub>∞</sub>(ClO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3</sub> and {[Co(tmphen)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>3</sub>[Fe(CN)<sub>6</sub>]<sub>2</sub>[Mn(CH<sub>3</sub>OH)<sub>4</sub>]<sub>0.5</sub>[Mn(CH<sub>3</sub>OH)<sub>3</sub>(CH<sub>3</sub>O)]}<sub>∞</sub>(ClO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3</sub>

The solutions were prepared by dissolving 49 mg (0.020 mmol) of the CoIII 2CoIIFeII 2 blue solid in 20 mL of methanol and 1000 mg (2.77 mmol) of Mn(ClO4)2·6H2O in 20 mL of methanol. The Co3Fe2 solution was layered onto the MnII solution in 2 mL/2 mL portions in 5 mm i.d. Pyrex glass tubes, which led to the formation of dark-blue X-ray-quality crystals of both products after 2 days.

{[Co(tmphen)<sub>2</sub>]<sub>3</sub>[Fe(CN)<sub>6</sub>]<sub>2</sub>[Mn(CH<sub>3</sub>OH)<sub>4</sub>]}<sub>∞</sub>(ClO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3</sub>

The solutions were prepared by dissolving 49 mg (0.020 mmol) of the CoIII 2CoIIFeII 2 blue solid in 40 mL of methanol and 244 mg (0.600 mmol) of [Mn(acac)2(H2O)2]ClO4 in 40 mL of methanol. For bulk reactions, the Co3Fe2 solution was layered on the MnIII solution in 4 mL/4 mL portions in glass vials and left to stand for 1 week. The dark-blue crystals were harvested, washed with methanol, and dried in vacuo. Yield: 43.3 mg (81%). IR (Nujol), ν(CN), cm−1: 2140, 2103, and 2061. X-ray-quality crystals were grown by layering of the two solutions in 2 mL/2 mL portions in 5 mm i.d. Pyrex glass tubes.
clean_text:
{[Co(tmphen)2]3[Fe(CN)6]2}. The CoIII 2CoIIFeII 2 blue solid form of the cluster was prepared by a variation of our previously reported synthesis. A solution of [(18-crown-6)K]3[Fe(CN)6] was prepared by stirring of 180 mg (0.547 mmol) of K3[Fe(CN)6] and 408 mg (1.54 mmol) of 18-crown-6 in 60 mL of acetonitrile for 24 h and filtering of the resulting solution to remove the excess K3[Fe(CN)6]. The other solution was prepared by combining 300 mg (1.03 mmol) of Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O with 609 mg (2.58 mmol) of tmphen in 150 mL of acetonitrile. To this solution was slowly added the [Fe(CN)6]3- solution, and the mixture was left to stand undisturbed for 3 days. The red crystals were collected by filtration, washed with acetonitrile (15 mL) and diethyl ether (30 mL), dried in vacuo, and left in air for at least 2 weeks to allow the sample to absorb ~24 water molecules of hydration. Yield: 477 mg (75%).

{[Ni(tmphen)2]3[Os(CN)6]2}

A sample of Ni(BF4)2⋅6H2O (109 mg, 0.320 mmol) was added to 157 mg (0.664 mmol) of tmphen in 80 mL of acetonitrile, and the mixture was stirred for 30 min to afford a clear pale-pink solution. This solution was added to (PPN)3[Os(CN)6] (762 mg, 0.388 mmol) in 80 mL of acetonitrile. The mixture was left to stand for 5 days, after which time transparent orange needlelike crystals that had formed were collected by filtration, washed with acetonitrile (2 × 20 mL), and dried in vacuo. Yield: 212 mg (42%).

Mixture of {[Co(tmphen)2]3[Fe(CN)6]2[Mn(CH3OH)4]}∞(ClO4)3 and {[Co(tmphen)2]3[Fe(CN)6]2[Mn(CH3OH)4]0.5[Mn(CH3OH)3(CH3O)]}∞(ClO4)3 

The solutions were prepared by dissolving 49 mg (0.020 mmol) of the CoIII 2CoIIFeII 2 blue solid in 20 mL of methanol and 1000 mg (2.77 mmol) of Mn(ClO4)2⋅6H2O in 20 mL of methanol. The Co3Fe2 solution was layered onto the MnII solution in 2 mL/2 mL portions in 5 mm i.d. Pyrex glass tubes, which led to the formation of dark-blue X-ray-quality crystals of both products after 2 days.

{[Co(tmphen)2]3[Fe(CN)6]2[Mn(CH3OH)4]}∞(ClO4)3 

The solutions were prepared by dissolving 49 mg (0.020 mmol) of the CoIII 2CoIIFeII 2 blue solid in 40 mL of methanol and 244 mg (0.600 mmol) of [Mn(acac)2(H2O)2]ClO4 in 40 mL of methanol. For bulk reactions, the Co3Fe2 solution was layered on the MnIII solution in 4 mL/4 mL portions in glass vials and left to stand for 1 week. The dark-blue crystals were harvested, washed with methanol, and dried in vacuo. Yield: 43.3 mg (81%). IR (Nujol), ν(CN), cm-1: 2140, 2103, and 2061. X-ray-quality crystals were grown by layering of the two solutions in 2 mL/2 mL portions in 5 mm i.d. Pyrex glass tubes.
